intro: Rondeletia eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
